description.narrative: Output 1.3: By 2023, improved capacity of the Government (Ministry of Education and Training, Ministry of Health, Ministry of Social Development) to provide high quality early childhood development, care and pre-primary education., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Early Childhood Development, Early Childhood Development (Covid), Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning Outcomes, Learning Outcomes (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 1:By 2023, young children (0 to 9 years), particularly the most vulnerable, benefit from gender responsive health, nutrition and early learning services.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 1.3: By 2023, improved capacity of the Government (Ministry of Education and Training, Ministry of Health, Ministry of Social Development) to provide high quality early childhood development, care and pre-primary education.

description.narrative: Quality in ECE is being addressed by provision of pre-service and in-service training of teachers offered by the LCE which continued, covering 65 (61 female, 4 male) pre-service trainees and 134 (131 female, 3 male) in-service trainees bringing the total number of trained teachers to a cumulative number of 1627. In addition, ECE and scaling up of reception classes has been included in the revised ESP as one of the sector priorities which is likely to influence budget allocation in the next fiscal year. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019
